author: Jason Lee @jasondeanlee
text:
Why Gemini 3 is a flop , despite the Codeforces/ICPC/IMO/putnam gold medals etc. 
Improving mathematical reasoning capabilities is like a plumber patching a leak. Imagine math reasoning as a d=20  dimensional ball. If we want to improve competition performance, we introduce data on a certain dimension then finetune/RL and that applies a patch of radius 0.5. If you want to cover the ball, you need 2^20 =10^6 patches, impossible. If you introduce data for IMO, nearby things on the same dimension (e.g. putnam) will considerably improve, but it won't help you pass a qual exam in statistics or do research in stats.
No amount of improvement in competition math will lead to being able to do math, statistics, optimization, MLAI theory research. It's on a different dimension.
